website_summaries.verdict: Earthwise offers a lot of features for the money including the ability to break through really tough dirt.
pros: Wheels fold up to allow for extra depth while tilling
Brand makes 4 sizes from 7.5 inches to 16 inches
A powerful tiller for the price
Small, but very sturdy and able to till a lot of space without overheating or showing signs of wear
cons: If you are tilling vines, you will have to stop and clean off the tines often or the tiller may bind up

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tiller for my garden.
customer_reviews.text: I have a medium size garden area, and was tilling with a manual one earlier and was taking lot of time and energy. I read many reviews of this one and decided to buy. Took no time to till 3 of my vegetable beds. I had to put a heavy stone in the front while tilling to keep it in place, other than that I didn't see any issues. After using I cleaned and it took a bit of time, nothing wrong with the product, its with the amount of things in my lawn. I strongly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: CSG

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful machine
customer_reviews.text: We needed to till a segment of our property and I was going to rent a gas powered tiller. The cost to rent for one day was around $110. I looked into purchasing one and the reviews on this model were quite good. I researched beyond the rating here and the results were the same. This tiller is amazing. A couple of things: It takes some strength to control it, but so does any tiller; It digs right in and churns the hardest soil; I ran 200 feet of heavy extension cord and had no problem. Suffice to say, its well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bob G

customer_reviews.title: Worked only once.
customer_reviews.text: First use was amazing. It worked great. It hasn’t worked since. I tried different outlets. I bought a different extension cord. I even had an electrician friend come out to make sure I had enough power going to my outlets. He said it was without a doubt the tiller that was broken. I didn’t work it hard the first time either. I have a very small garden that I’ve kept for nearly 20 years. I threw this piece of junk away and bout a gas powered one. Not my preference, but I need a tiller that works.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: Even works in hard, red clay-like dirt
customer_reviews.text: This is a magnificent machine. I used to have a gas-powered Mantis tiller that would be such a pain to start and deal with fumes while I was really getting into the dirt. Not with this beauty. The only problem is the shield that protects you from the dirt getting kicked up got bent enough that when I put the wheels back down that the wheels would not turn. I was able to bend the metal down by stepping on it. Otherwise, this is a perfect product. I used this to help when a landscaping company dumped fill dirt and not topsoil in my yard. This and in red clay dirt.
customer_reviews.author: PHILLIP M BURDA

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had bought this sooner
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, this machine makes for light work. I would recomend this for smaller areas, but it will do big jobs too. It's just a wider machine would work better for bigger jobs. I had been using a very small battery operated rototiller and it took for ever and then I'd have to recharge the battery. Kik love that it is corded. No job or power interruptions because of low battery. Also no headaches because of gas oil issues. This little guy gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: An incredible, powerful machine that does everything it is advertised to do. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible power and easy to assemble with excellent directions. It functions 10 times better than the last battery operated rototiller I had abd cost $60 less. The batteries for my battery operated rototiller cost about $99 a piece. For just a little more I was able to buy this wonderful rototiller that works the best of any rototiller I have ever had. I have had large rototillers with which to do large areas of my garden which I would use for my big Garden. However, I have grow boxes and this rototiller did the job for me in unappreciative, really good time. I would highly recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: David D. Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! I was super worried it wouldnt do the job being electric but it did my garden area perfectly! I was also a little concerned it would be difficult for me to operate and learn how to use it and I was able to figure it out pretty easily and had no trouble using it! Put together of it was also really simple and easy! I know some other reviews stated it stopped working after a few times but I tilled my garden 4 times, my mom did hers twice and my best friend did her back yard with it and it's still working like a champ and giving my my money's worth!
customer_reviews.author: CallieT

customer_reviews.title: Turned our super crusty El Paso dirt backyard into something easier to ...
customer_reviews.text: Turned our super crusty El Paso dirt backyard into something easier to look at. Pictures don't do justice to the amount of little weeds growing in our backyard. We can't afford fully landscaping right now, chemical control with concentrates was useless, and pulling weeds was exhausting and near impossible to do right because of how hard the dirt was the roots would snap off. 13.5 is no joke. This machine cut through the hard clay dirt like a hot knife through butter. Unfortunately, I hit tons of hidden rocks and construction pieces from when the house was built eight years ago. The machine tossed them forward and luckily the tills were in excellent shape despite hitting a thousand rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: This is one tough little machine. I don't think I'd try to do an acre with it but I've used it to put in a small garden from a patch of grass. The first pass just pulls up the grass. Rake, put the wheels up and go to town. At one point, a large rock got wedged into the tines. With a little work I managed to dislodge it and the little machine went right back to work. It digs in nicely to easily six inches. If you need go deeper you can make several passes but at that point I consider turning it with a shove first and then let this guy cultivate.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Awesome power, tough little machine!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast for its size! It will tear through wet or dry dirt and even through thick sod with a couple passes. This made digging a 16” trench SO much easier. The one thing to note, though, is that it does leave a center rut. So when digging our trench, we had to make a pass, dig the center rut out with a shovel, then make another pass. But it was still SO worth it and made the job a million times easier. It’s light enough we can pick it up and till up our raised garden beds. with it. Great little machine!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Tough, powerful, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Have no space for a real rototiller so bought this after comparing many electric ones on Amazon. Very happy with the purchase and it works like a champ, overpowers many obstacles and roots. Only stopped twice when confronted with roots about 1 and 1/2 inch in diameter and very long. Even so, I stopped the unit right away for fear of burning out the motor but so far, the motor has the same power as before these incidents. Very easy to clean and handle. Love it, have used in another location of approximately same size, 200 sq feet and performed nicely. Easy peasy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Suprisingly useful
customer_reviews.text: 1st - make sure you are using a beefy 12ga extension cord. 2nd - Make sure you are using 14amp rated or higher plug. Do not use in wet. This device is very light. Yet it still tears through vine covered ground efficiently. Had to clear windup a few times but still that was to be expected. Item is quiet. It does bounce a lot - it is light as stated. I am surprised how useful it is in my small garden. oh.. make sure if you buy this, you have covered storage. can't think of anything else. Pretty solid device for tilling close to the house.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A. Neal

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: The machine is light enough to carry around one handed but it is very powerful. The combination can be a bit tricky as it has a tendency to hop around a bit when encountering tough soil, rocks, roots, etc. Hang onto it! On the other hand it has the power to grind through heavy clay soil that is completely sun baked. Never a stall. For loamy slightly damp, or previously tilled soil it smoothly does a great job stirring things up to a depth of about the blades; I imagine deeper if you were to work at it. This is a great alternative to lugging around my old 250# gas tiller!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This tiller has been very heavily used and still works just like it did out of the box. If your expectations are for what this is made to do, then you will be very happy. It has as much or more power than I expected. It was so easy to use. Don't buy one with a cord and then complain that the cord can be annoying. After a few mins you get used to the cord. I used this on some small jobs but also large. I tilled my backyard to prepare for sod. I have more than got my use out of this for the price so I don't mind if it sits a long time until needed again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Superb Machine
customer_reviews.text: Kept this stored for ~3yrs and finally took it out and used it to till a medium-sized section of backyard. Man, this thing is powerful and saved me time and backbreaking work to properly till this section. The tiller is intuitive to use, but it does take a short while to get the hang of using it. I had my doubts that an electric tiller could provide the necessary power to till, but this machine leaves no doubt. A well-built, well-designed machine that I unequivocally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tiller on recommendation of a friend, and was not disappointed! The tiller has more than enough power for what I need it for,in our sandy Florida soils....and very maneuverable so tilling up raised beds is not an issue. The only minimal complaint I have, is the wheels........I wish they were larger, so that when I was moving the tiller, the tines didn't catch on everything. Overall, its a great addition to our mini farm, and I am truly happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Amps that a machine has - amps is to electric devices as HP is to gasoline devices
customer_reviews.text: I have used a Mantis tiller for years and I can't say enough good things about it. I have gotten older (73) and I just don't have the dedication to tinkering with the gasoline engine every spring to get it running, I needed something that would start when I needed it to start. I decided on an electric tiller but I needed to make sure that it was powerful enough to get through my rather large garden. The Earthwise tiller with 13.5 amp motor seemed just what I needed. Other than having to keep my eye on the electric extension cord, it has done everything I have expected of it.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Paulson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant to try an electric tiller but didn't want to spend a lot of money on a new tiller since I'm downsizing my garden. I'm very glad I bought this product. So far it works great. A gas tiller would probably be better if you have a large garden and do a lot of tilling. But for smaller gardens and if you need something lite weight you can't go wrong with this tiller. Good for the environment, too.
customer_reviews.author: mom53

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and not for the faint of heart.
customer_reviews.text: This tiller/cultivator is very powerful and not for the faint of heart. It was easy to assemble and simple to start however, you will need upper body strength to operate it. It is also imperative that you pay attention to the power cord during operation as you try to maintain control and ensure the cord does not get in the path of the tines. My box was slightly damaged when arrived and I noticed the "protective shield" was bent when I took it out of the box.....fortunately, this has not interfered with the performance thus far. ~Kimberly
customer_reviews.author: Sooieets

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I truly cannot sing enough praises of this tiller! For the price, the low operating cost, and the shocking performance of this tiller, a person wanting to fill a single family garden would be a fool to pass it up. It is small, thus more rows are required, but I have tilled multiple small brand new garden areas for several friends and family in less than 30 minutes. 100% A+++ score!!!! Operating advice: follow the suggested instructions. Operate in rows, tilling 3-4’ backwards, moving forward 1’ and then back 3-4’ more, and continue each row in this pattern.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Akers

customer_reviews.title: broke after 10 minutes of light use
customer_reviews.text: piece of junk broke almost immediately. i followed the directions and it was easy to set up. it worked great for a total of ten minutes before it started making a horrible clunking sound and stopped working. i didn't hit a rock or root or anything like that. i'm very disappointed and will avoid earthwise products in the future. amazon app won't let me post picture of the rock-free dirt i used it on, i also wanted to share a video of the awful sound it makes when we try to turn it on now
customer_reviews.author: puddle duck

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller
customer_reviews.text: So happy I went with this little guy. So much easier than trying to start a gasoline motor (bad luck in the past). I'm in the south and it tore thru centipede grass. Granted, it does not have the power of a gas tiller, it shocked me how well it did. It even cut up clay chunks. Fairly easy to put together, but instructions were not that clear. However, you can figure it out with a little common sense.
customer_reviews.author: T.Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Powerful.  sometimes too powerful...
customer_reviews.text: Works better than imagined; however, The problem with electric is you have off and on. No clutch, no speeds, just Ready? and HOLD ON MOFO... I tried it with and w/o the side tines. It is a nice option to have when the ground is firm, dry or lots of tiny roots. I am so tired of gas engine devices and winterizing, so I have many electric items: this, weed eater, battery mower (got it free), leaf blower, etc. If they could only make a device like the Rye Oh Bee multitool and have it do all the above, great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B NoVA

customer_reviews.title: Worth it even if it lasts 2yrs - what do you want for a small cheap tiller
customer_reviews.text: Update: 1month later company still has bot honored waranty and offered no solutions. Update: lasted 5months now dead. Previous review: Came with a small leak that is likely not any issue. Only time will tell if it holds up agains my more solid than clay soils. Its a little terrifying how much it bounces around but it does eventually break through. And it has amazing power. Dislodged some minor boulders buried deep in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: It's a beast.
customer_reviews.text: I am a 5' tall 72-year-old woman, so try and visualized me hanging on as this machine as it turns on. It is really amazing just not like our old gas one that I used for years. It doesn't have the ability to power down it just starts off full bore and has no stabilizer bar at the back to help hold it down. NOW that being said, it is POWERFUL and did what I wanted it to do and if you have the stamina and balance it will do what you need. It chewed up old lawn like no tomorrow, even my Son was impressed. Can't beat it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: judy eastham

customer_reviews.title: One tough Machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is one "Bear" of a machine! I'm giving it one heck of a work out loosening up packed down wood chips mixed with dirt from a stump that I had ground. I can only imagine that it will be great to till and fluff up gardens that have normal packed soil. The trigger handle is in the right spot for easy on and off. The wheels make it easy to move around, and flip up and lock into place for tilling. Packaged in one of the better boxes I've seen and arrived in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Scanty22

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Growing up on a farm and now living life in the suburbs I almost didn't order this machine thinking it would be "a glorified weed eater" - too light to do anything, little torque, etc. Wow was I wrong! This machine is STRONG - was able to till up about 1/5 of an acre of hard clay in less than an hour! The thing is so ferocious my son and I nicknamed it "the Tasmanian Devil" ! It's not very heavy so it does bounce around some on very hard clay, and of course roots will have to be removed by hand, but all in all this tool is fantastic. Clear your space and send this $130 warrior into battle!
customer_reviews.author: David Forrest

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: i've used gas powered tillers in the past, now i've a little garden that was covered in the usual grass layer and i wanted to prepare for planting vegetables. First i tilled it manually to break up the incredibly hard roots on the grass, then i used this tiller to finish the job. I got the 13.5A version and it has quite some power. in the soil there were pieces of concrete, stones, pieces of iron, tree branches and the very hard grass blocks. It dealt with everything very nicely. Highly recommended if you don't have too large of a surface to prepare.
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to get
customer_reviews.text: After researching electric tillers I decided on this one and I'm glad I did. It's the right size for my raised garden beds, has plenty of power, and easy to move from one to the other, 8 in all. I did have to purchase a 12ga 50ft extension cord that I powered off my 12v 3000/6000 watt inverter (13.5A X 120V = 1620W) on solar power. Not one issue at all tilling 8 beds. No more gas, oil or maintenance for me. If you're looking for an electric tiller, this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: 13amp unit is powerful and reliable
customer_reviews.text: What? Pick up with one hand? So glad I tried going electric instead of gas. This sturdy unit just chewed up my yard without a hitch. Grinding down through 6" of packed soil, it sliced, chopped and macerated the many roots (including tree roots upwards of 1"). Yes, this type of tillage is tiring and requires routine clearing of the blades. There's no escaping that, other than paying someone else to do the work. I give it two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little tiller.
customer_reviews.text: When I first used this tiller, I though it might be a little too aggressive. But with experience I quickly learned that the 13.5amp tiller stepped up to the task and performed. It is powerful and you have to keep your mind on what you are doing, but this results in a near perfect job of tilling soil down to 6-8 inches. I WOULD recommend this tool. -Dallen
customer_reviews.author: Dallen

customer_reviews.title: Quality built for the money and easy assembly.
customer_reviews.text: At first glance this appears to be a quality unit. I have not used it yet, but will be tilling raised beds and fixing some spots in the yard with it. It is replacing a 2cycle tiller we had used for years but got tired of trying to get it started. Upon assembly, be sure to remove the tines and grease the shaft and put them back on. It is raw steel and will rust quickly. Doing this each time after using it will ensure quick dissasembly for cleaning at seasons end. I also like the fill/drain plugs on gearbox so the grease can be maintained.
customer_reviews.author: lewiscountykid

customer_reviews.title: Super little cultivator!!
customer_reviews.text: This electric cultivator is outstanding! Not too difficult to assemble, well-built. This machine will dig up some serious dirt! No trouble with hard-packed soil as long as you drag it backward, as the directions indicate. I used 150 feet of 12 gauge extension cord, and it (the cord) didn't even get warm. The cultivator motor was able to take quite an extended period of operation without getting hot. I am totally satisfied!!
customer_reviews.author: kwmar

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to work a 10' X 20' garden plot. Used it to till in compost/manure etc to put the garden plot to bed for the winter. It worked as expected. It was perhaps more powerful than I thought it would be, but that's a good thing. It easily tilled 8" deep in the garden soil. Clean up took a little time since you need to take the tines off to clean them. It's stored away for the winter now. We did not use it on any really hard compacted soil or soil with grass or vegetation so don't know how it would work on that. Worked well for what we bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: bird2day

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power.
customer_reviews.text: My soil is extremely hard and clumpy clay this thing powers right threw it with a little pre-soaking. My yard is about 3k sq feet and it was used for 30 min + at a time with no issues. I have always used heavy gas tillers and I find dragging the cord around is a pain, just something I need to get used to. It is also very lightweight, almost to light. When the ground is hard it tends to bounce around.
customer_reviews.author: Evil Fish

customer_reviews.title: Really really great tiller
customer_reviews.text: I have about 300 square feet of garden that I used to rent a tiller for. The rented tiller was big and spewed fumes and was about 350 pounds and costed me $60 for 4 hours. This electric tiller is not as big or fast as the gas one, but it does a very good job and it is really easy to use. Plus, no fumes, and I can pick it up and hang it on the wall in the shed. Virtually no maintenance. So happy to have it!
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Gas No More!
customer_reviews.text: Took a risk buying this as I was dedicated to gas tillers for years. Got tired of them not working after a season or two (well known brands). Pulled this out of the box and went right to work in ten minutes. There is a challenge keeping the extension cord from getting wrapped around the times, but the unit is so maneuverable this is manageable. Very powerful and breaks up my Potomac river sediment soil that hardens to the consistency of asphalt in dry times. No gas or oil to mix or fiddle with. Would suggest a heavier long extension cord if you do not already have one.
customer_reviews.author: neely

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed, great machine!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed! I did have some major doubts about getting an electric one but we couldn't afford a gas powered one. We have sandy dirt with tough clay a few inches beneath it. This had no problem getting through it. Make sure to hang on good, this has major power for it being so light weight. Make sure to clean out anything that may get wrapped around the blades after every use. We have already used it multiple times with no problem, I highly recommend! Tree roots it struggles a bit, as expected but will eventually get through.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: broke within minutes. Safety issue
customer_reviews.text: Product came with manufacturing defect to cord. Cord melted almost immediately after starting. Very disappointing but also could have been a major safety issue if the live wires would have contacted the metal frame.
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: I’m over 50 and can use it !
customer_reviews.text: I’m a girl and I’m over 50 and I can use this thing with no problems and I love it everything grows great
customer_reviews.author: Corrine Murphy

customer_reviews.title: A lean rototiller with monster teeth
customer_reviews.text: Pros* Breaks up ground like a beast. Price point is great on budget. Corded dont need gas Cons Must be near an outlet and have long extension cord to get to project. Cord can get in way when using it. I would recommend this to small garden spaces and those on a budget. Just bought it so unsure long term quaility.
customer_reviews.author: Rewster

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 2 cycle version from a big box store, used it one season, and it died bad motor. It was twice the price of the Earthwise. It worked well, better than expected. It has as much or more power than my old one. Only complaint , house have to watch your extension cord. Minor issue . The Earthwise is worth the money the I paid for it. I would recommend this to anyone with a small to medium size garden.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and economical.
customer_reviews.text: For the pricepoint, It's the best in its class. But the minor design flaw I noticed was the gap between times dead center is too wide. If you're rolling a bed where you literally only have room for one pass, it leaves an unturned strip of topsoil in the center. Then you have to break out the shovel and turn the soil the old fashioned way anyways. Though to be fair it did make th at much easier to accomplish. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Love this tiller
customer_reviews.text: I got the 13.5 amp model and found this tiller a real gem. I used to have a Mantis and found the Earthwise to be very comparable in terms of how well it can chew through tough ground. It handled rocks and hard clay surprisingly well. No more gas. No more cranking. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Swope

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Would give it a very good review ,but arrived damaged in the box. No damage to the box so it is obvious that manufacturer or workers didn't care the damaged tiller was shipped as is. Poor quality. Control. Works good but lack of care.
customer_reviews.author: Electric Drive

customer_reviews.title: Best Tiller
customer_reviews.text: This is the toughest little tiller on the planet. We ran it through rocky ground breaking a new garden and it never missed a beat. Even ran over an unseen large rock that we had to use a chisel to break up and remove. Once again it ran without any problems. I recommend this tiller to everyone that is looking for a great electric tiller.
customer_reviews.author: western

customer_reviews.title: Tough machine that works great
customer_reviews.text: I am reseeding my lawn - tilling the old dead grass and replanting new seed on 2500 sqft of area. The tiller ran for 8 hours straight without a problem. It did a great job and was easy to use. Much better to buy this than rent one from HD. Used over 3 days it was perfect and worked as hard as a gas one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little beast
customer_reviews.text: This little beast tilled easily through our compacted clay soils. After using a rented gas tiller some years, this unit far surpassed any I used. It's light, yet tough. Easy to move around. Easy to clean, and takes up little room in the garage. As others noted, it's most aggressive when pulling backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J

customer_reviews.title: Great power for such a small tiller
customer_reviews.text: Is able to handle med sized rocks with no problem. Just tosses them aside. I live in the hight desert. Therefore all soil has rocks in it. It cannot handle hardpan or larger rocks. Use pick Ax to break up the hardpan. Great tiller.
customer_reviews.author: BIONIC LADY

customer_reviews.title: Transmission Broke 30 Seconds Out-of-the-BOX
customer_reviews.text: 30 Seconds... that's a new record for me. It was doing a very good job in fairly soft soil, and then the transmission broke. Motor spins, but the tines will not. I submitted a warranty request w/ the company, but after seeing all of the 1-star reviews, I'm sending it back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Barnstormer

customer_reviews.title: It’s strong, powerful, takes a licking and keeps on ticking!
customer_reviews.text: This is an unbelievable machine. First I used it to till my garden to get rid of the weeds and it was great. Then I discovered a beautiful buried circular fieldstone type flower bed which I had forgotten about, which I may have seen when we first bought the house. Anyway this machine is amazing because it cut through the compacted dirt and all the rocks. For the money this is an amazing machine! You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Ira L.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job very well
customer_reviews.text: Performed better than expected, would buy again and recommend, after my project gave it to the gardener that will have many projects for it. Worked for hours in the Florida heat without fault or overheating. Cut through grass roots and some clay. Impressive. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Luiz

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast
customer_reviews.text: It helps to be in shape to control this monster. But if you're not in shape it will get you there. It has a ton of power, but it lacks the weight of a big gas cultivator. But there isn't much that can be done about that. I've only tried it for one evening so far and it's ripped up my grass and weeds smashingly well. Excellent choice if you have more time and musclke than money.
customer_reviews.author: Lasivian Leandros

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use tiller, super impressive
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tiller, I used it to dig up swales for collecting rain water. Our property has a gentle slope and a little water that we get usually runs off. This thing is a little monster, it dug up rocks, and plowed through hard earth super easy. You will get a workout still.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Has ample power needs something to help you keep on track.
customer_reviews.text: Has plenty of power dig into garden soil. I found that I have to pull it backwards or it tends to pull me around and dig deep down and off the track I'm filling. I 'm 74 but thought I could handle it, the woman who said she could handle it definitely must work out regularly. I mow a three acre hilly field with 3 ft weeds using a push mower (gasoline) and am less stressed than tilling four 20 ft garden rows.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for smaller jobs, but not bad for bigger jobs either!
customer_reviews.text: I put the Tiller together in 10 minutes without even reading the instructions. Then I tilled up a section of my front yard that was hard as red clay. The little tiller went right through it with no problem. I even hit rock and that didnt stop it. All in all, you cant beat this tiller for the price.
customer_reviews.author: WV Radio Guy

customer_reviews.title: maybe too light?
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my ex who wanted to till her garden. I suppose it did the job but it was so lightweight it barely scratched the surface. Most times it took multiple passes just to get an inch of loose dirt. I suppose it was a fair purchase for the cost but ill never know....🤷‍♂️
customer_reviews.author: RJ Foster

customer_reviews.title: All around best tiller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tiller for a large flower bed, and it has performed great. It has plenty of power, my husband has “borrowed” it for his vegetable garden, because it is so much easier to use than his big gas tiller. Our neighbor has borrowed it for his landscaping job, too. It may be my best purchase in years
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive for its size and cost
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, about 10 minutes. Surprisingly powerful tiller, but you do have to manhandle it a bit. Does till the ground surprising well and cuts through small roots easily (however, you will have to clean the roots that wrap around the tines and shaft periodically - just like any other tiller).
customer_reviews.author: Sarah J DeBold

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for prepping flower bed & vegetable gardens.
customer_reviews.text: Four stars for now, used it twice and was amazed how powerful it is. When using it to start a new area for planting it will buck in harder soil (be ready for that) but works like a charm in established areas. Yes it is corded so be careful. If you have another person to guide the power cord out of the way at a safe distance the job will go faster.
customer_reviews.author: Mtn. John

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a MONSTER
customer_reviews.text: So pleased with this roto-tiller. It helped me till 4k sq feet yard in no time for re-seeding everything. It is really powerful and requires some strong arms to control but aside of that does the job as needed. Assembly was fast and easy. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: The Joe

customer_reviews.title: Works like a gas tiller.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome tiller for the price. Its works surprisingly well. I am in Georgia and this little thing went through the GA red clay with relative ease. The only draw back is that you have to splash the cash on an expensive power cord so this tiller can function at optimal level. I love the fact this I will not have to mess around with cleaning carburetors or fine tuning a small engine on a gas tiller.
customer_reviews.author: Kfosuhene

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for tilling flower beds and a small garden. Because a tiller is not often used I have had problems with the small gasoline engine types starting after sitting for long periods. I decided to try this electric tiller. It is more powerful than I expected. It does the job. It is a real tiller that does all I need it to do and it starts every time with no rope to pull.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great for working soil
customer_reviews.text: Received this yesterday and put it to the test today. Ran it for about 3 hours solid without a problem. It is very light, which is great for moving it around and working soil that is already broken up. I also used it to increase the size of our garden plot by about 70 square feet. Since it is lighter than a gas machine it bounced pretty hard, but all things considered I am happy with my purchase. Update: Month later with multiple uses, still love it.
customer_reviews.author: J.Mcleod

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous power.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very impressive machine. 20 minutes after it arrived on my porch is was at work in the backyard prepping the yard for the 200 yards of sod that is being delivered on the 9th. I wasn't expecting half as much for the money, but I bought their electric de-thatcher last fall and both are an excellent choice for a home owner. Electric is the way to go. The future's so bright, I gotta wear shades.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME!!!! My wife loves it. Our gas tiller was a pain in the but. We love the ease of assembly and operation.
customer_reviews.author: Beekeeper

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised - it's a beast!
customer_reviews.text: I did some research before buying, and read the good reviews for this product so gave it a try. It was a big project - so I really put it to the test - tilling up an old lawn & weeds that I killed with Roundup. It was a large area, about 2500 sq/ft and this guy powered through it like a champ. It ripped old the old turf and dug through some very hard dirt and got the job done. For the price of renting a tiller, this makes much more sense. Now I'll keep it around for smaller projects like a garden (when it warms up outside).
customer_reviews.author: Sir Charles

customer_reviews.title: plenty of torque
customer_reviews.text: I have used several tillers, and this has as much or more torque then any others I've used. Prepping my garden for tomatoes and I plant them deep, this has tilled about 2 feet down after removing the loose dirt and all the rocks that were kicked up! Only had one rock get stuck in the times, used the pry bar to get it out, no damage to the tines and on we go. Will up date as I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Judiaz

customer_reviews.title: and I am very pleased. The only problem I have had
customer_reviews.text: This is my first tiller, and I am very pleased. The only problem I have had, is having to clean out the tines while plowing through grass sod. The grass was thick and old, and this guy tore it up. Every few feet, I would have to turn it over and cut out the grass that got stuck. I did not have this problem at all in my already tilled beds. It tears everything up, is pretty easy to handle, and does the job great. I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa CF

customer_reviews.title: Not for breaking through hard soil!
customer_reviews.text: First one I recieved the power cord was damaged in their packaging process. I returned it for a replacement and they sent the new one before I even dropped the damaged one off at UPS. Awesome service right there. If you're getting this to turn over gardens or flowerbeds once or twice a year you should be ok. If you think you're going to break new ground with this then you're going to struggle quite a bit. It just doesn't have the weight or variable speed needed to get through hard soil that a gas engine tiller does. After my first use in my vegetable garden this thing will make everything so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Coenen

customer_reviews.title: A great tool for a beginning gardener
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this, assembled it and used it all by myself. It is a good tool for a small garden project, in my opinion. I hope to try it out on a bigger project in the fall. I like that it is electric. Just make sure you follow the user instructions. It is easy to get the cord in the way if you don't secure it right or don't pay attention.
customer_reviews.author: LeeLee2006

customer_reviews.title: Works like a cheap tiller -that's not a bad thing.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty happy overall with this product. It's easy and light to use. I am not really strong enough to use it for a long time. I wasn't too happy with the depth but maybe I should have used it longer. Considering how much heavier duty tillers cost I thought the way it worked was equivalent to the price. It is a LIGHT duty tiller.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fortune

customer_reviews.title: This machine is beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: I used my old rototiller (purchased in 1974) as an excavator to widen my driveway and other major earth moving projects. However the old one was very heavy and hard to control. My NEW Earthwise TC70016 16-Inch 13.5-Amp Corded Electric Tiller is light and easy to control. It works WONDERFULLY to till garden soils that do not have rocks or roots. I really love this machine. It will make my gardening my easier and better.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Zographos

customer_reviews.title: Amazing how well it tills
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this last year but didn't use it until this spring. I am impressed with how well it tills the soil and pulverizes the earth. I must say that for being and electric motor it is quite strong. Would recommend it to anyone that has a small garden.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerJules

customer_reviews.title: a Sturdy little tiller - did the job well - no hickups.
customer_reviews.text: Stronger and sturdier than expected. I had to till a rock hard parcel of soil - approximately 700 sq. Feet - divided the work up in two sessions. I operated the machine by dragging it backwards because of the soil conditions and it worked out perfectly. No overheating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful for the size
customer_reviews.text: Money well spent. It does a better job than expected. I'm using it to till the soil to plant seeds. It runs thru the terrain with plenty of power and penetrates at least 3-4inches without applying strength. If only my lawn mower worked like this.... the thing was also very easy to assemble, just have to follow the diagram sequence....
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough for a 60 year old woman!
customer_reviews.text: I was going to rent a rotoriller because I wanted to redo part of my yard. I looked at the cost of renting and then saw this machine. This was a great investment! I have had no problems and have been able to create all kinds of new garden beds thanks to this machine! The hardest part is making sure the power cord is over my shoulder and out of the way! My yard is absolutely loaded with rocks and this machine plows right through. We have bittersweet roots and they are no match either. If you are thinking of renting, don’t do it! $129 ! It’s worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Tatoian

customer_reviews.title: pretty good, not USA
customer_reviews.text: it would be great if 100% USA manufactured Update: isn't the easiest iv used, but big gas tillers can be finicky to keep maintained in good running condition. Can't complain about price & performance here. Made in USA would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Paul USMC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little tiller!!
customer_reviews.text: This little tiller is awesome! I have always borrowed and used the gas powered 5 hp tillers. I decided to resod a large section of my backyard so I bought this little gem so I didn’t have to haul the huge gas powered around in my truck.. It works great I would definitely recommend. I ended up tilling up 1463 sq ft of my yard in 1 day.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth G.

customer_reviews.title: Works really well!!
customer_reviews.text: I've now had this one full year/two gardening seasons. It was inexpensive but works GREAT! Light weight, push button start, breaks up heavy/clay soul well. It requires several passes, mind. It's so light that it doesn't push down into the ground much. Still, I'm very, very happy with this!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. Seuferer

customer_reviews.title: Best Roto Tiller
customer_reviews.text: I have been gardening over 50m years and this is the best roto tiller I ever used!!!! I bought it when my 5hp gas model died and will never go back to gas. Very powerful. I tilled a 10' X 45' garden in about an hour and a half. Tore through dense soil and rock. Quiet and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Keane

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: As advertised and exactly what i needed for tedious light weight work around concrete walk ways, pave stones and flower beds. Easy to maneuver. Use it in the most difficult of soils (North Texas black gumbo that has a bad attitude.) Works well with rare "bouncing" that is easily controlled. Am pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Goes hard on compacted soil and pulls weeds.
customer_reviews.text: I think this might be my first review on Amazon not sure. But I was really impressed with this machine. I used it today for the first time since ordering it. I put it together 5 days ago. Used it for about 2 hours with several breaks of course I'm not a machine. It really moves hard dirt around and if you are trying to pull weeds it will do that as well. I did trim the weed with a weed eater first they were about 18 inches tall. But after that this thing got the weeds out roots included.
customer_reviews.author: Edna Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Hold on!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely fast, powerful, sharp piece of equipment. I was concerned that it would not have enough power, not an issue. Tends to walk away as do all tillers. Takes a little practice to steer. I found it helpful to have a second person to help control the extension cord. Unit should ship with two extra extension cords because eventually you're going to chew one up. Assembly was simple and fast, instructions clear, unit seems to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Great Find and Investment
customer_reviews.text: I've been using another popular brand of gas-powered tiller for years. I decided to try an electric version and searched here on Amazon. The Earthwise TC70016 has proven to be very effective in every way: easy to manipulate, digs deep, and no more gasoline.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Powerful easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a wonderful tool to have. It is easy to control and yet powerful enough to really get down and turn some tough soil. I like the design because I was able to take a very long extension cord and wrap it around the handle assembly nice and neatly so it is ready for use the next time :-)
customer_reviews.author: Gordon G. Hope

customer_reviews.title: Works great, powerful
customer_reviews.text: This thing really surprised me at how well it works. One problem though, when it gets hung up on a thick root it can be hard to free it because the tines can't be reversed. But that is more user error than a problem with the machine. I love it. Went together quickly and did a far better job that I expected it would.
customer_reviews.author: R. DuVal

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: This is an ok machine. I don't care for where the safety is positioned to turn it on as it tends to jerk it out of your hand if you have small hands. It doesn't have the tilling power is hoped for but it does ok.
customer_reviews.author: The Leighs

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a Beast!
customer_reviews.text: I’m almost embarrassed to show the before pictures of our backyard beach, but with a hard summer and the expense of putting in new sand we decided to put off fixing it up. We purchase this tiller because of the reviews and took a chance to see if it would bring up all the sand that was compacted down. This thing is a beast! It took less than an hour to do the whole beach! It pulled up all the weeds and made the sand soft again. We are going to start a garden next year so this thing will come in handy. Don’t hesitate just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Very good small garden tiller
customer_reviews.text: My family members have been able to use this tiller quite easily. I have been told it is much more powerful than slightly larger gas powered tillers that they have used and from my observation I have to agree (I'm disabled and cannot run myself). Definitely invest in getting the heavier (12 gauge minimum) electrical cord to use it properly, as the motor is 13.5 amps and will need that larger wire to allow the flow of current the motor requires to perform optimally.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Heim

customer_reviews.title: Not American made.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because it says American manufacturer. In fact, it is made in China. UPDATE: This is a powerful machine that goes beyond what I expected. Very well made. Wheels keep falling down when in the locked position, but doesn't interfere with the tilling.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Wilson

customer_reviews.title: It's worth the money for yard projects and small gardens.
customer_reviews.text: Since this is my first rototilling experience, I can't compare, but it worked for me. Easy to assemble, turned the soil, and it's still working. If it makes it through my next project and stops working, it will still be cheaper than hiring someone.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Ewert

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, ready to dig up hard clay dirt.
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is a fighter! It digs in and works hard. I thought an electric tiller, less than $150, that I can lift easily with a single hand, will be a children's toy. I am very impressed by this thing. It chewed through clay soil I was using a pick axe on. I am highly pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful for the price and easy to use, especially compared to gas powered models. Have already covered a lot of ground turning existing beds and tearing up sod while making new planting areas. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: mikesparky

customer_reviews.title: Works great with a little creativity and pre-soaking.
customer_reviews.text: This thing will dig. Granted you have to go backwards with it and get creative with your work. It works best 2 days after a rain or a good pre-soaking. I live in southern Oklahoma. Extra hard ground.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. I used it to clear grass and to turn the soil. It works great. I have St. Augustine grass, so the roots would wrap around the blade shank,so I had to cut it off the shank periodically. Despite this, the machine hammered through the job. I cleared the grass pretty easilyusing this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Samiha Qureshi

customer_reviews.title: This Tiller is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I am 65 years old with arthritis and I was able to till my garden up and then put a new flower bed in as well. If the tiller had been hard to handle I wouldn't have been able to do it. The only thing I don't like is having to watch the cord all the time. But I figured that out I just put it over my clothesline so it's off the ground. I love it now I don't have to hire someone to come do it for me.
customer_reviews.author: BuyingChristmas

customer_reviews.title: This small machine has plenty of power.
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised at the digging ability of this tiller. I used in a raised garden, and it surpassed my expectations. it dug so fast I had to keep raising it up, so it wouldn't go so deep. Loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is worth every penny. I checked out one of my local rental shops to inquire about a tiller and found the price to rent one for two days was equal to the purchase price of this one. This tiller had no problem getting through the slightly hardened ground and producing cultivated soil. I would totally recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: CES

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for old geezers
customer_reviews.text: This tiller has to be overpowered in order to control it. There is no stability rod to impede its progress. It requires strength and energy. It is for shallow tilling of loose dirt,
customer_reviews.author: L. Evatt

product_meta.title: Earthwise TC70016 16-Inch 13.5-Amp Corded Electric Tiller/Cultivator, Grey
product_meta.description: Size:16-InchThe Earthwise garden tiller cultivator is ideal for small to medium-sized gardens in your home. It has a powerful electric motor that delivers gas-like power without gas or fumes. This roto tiller electric has an planet-friendly and lightweight design that makes your outdoor tasks easy and hassle-free. You can use this tiller for soil maintenance, starting a new garden, refreshing your old garden, and prepping your soil based on the seasons. This electric cultivator tiller keeps your soil well-aerated while preventing weeds from growing around your plants.
feature_bullets: Comfortable ergonomic handle. Assembled product dimensions (L x w x h)-40.00 x 19.00 x 42.00 inches
Lightweight, easy to operate, and convenient to store.Tine length:16 inch

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,180 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
